payload.content: Henry Farrell is the Stavros Niarchos Foundation Agora Institute Professor of International Affairs at The School of Advanced International Studies at Johns Hopkins University.

name: Henry Farrell is the Stavros Niarchos Foundation Agora Institute Professor of In
content: Henry Farrell is the Stavros Niarchos Foundation Agora Institute Professor of International Affairs at The School of Advanced International Studies at Johns Hopkins University.

payload.content: Henry Farrell won the Friedrich Schiedel Prize for Politics and Technology in 2019.

name: Henry Farrell won the Friedrich Schiedel Prize for Politics and Technology in 20
content: Henry Farrell won the Friedrich Schiedel Prize for Politics and Technology in 2019.

payload.content: Henry Farrell previously served as a professor of political science and international affairs at George Washington University.

name: Henry Farrell previously served as a professor of political science and internat
content: Henry Farrell previously served as a professor of political science and international affairs at George Washington University.

payload.content: Henry Farrell's work focuses on democracy, the politics of the internet, and international and comparative political economy.

name: Henry Farrell's work focuses on democracy, the politics of the internet, and int
content: Henry Farrell's work focuses on democracy, the politics of the internet, and international and comparative political economy.

payload.content: Henry Farrell is the author of 'Of Privacy and Power: The Transatlantic Fight over Freedom and Security' (with Abraham Newman, 2019) and 'The Political Economy of Trust: Interests, Institutions and Inter-Firm Cooperation' (2009).

name: Henry Farrell is the author of 'Of Privacy and Power: The Transatlantic Fight ov
content: Henry Farrell is the author of 'Of Privacy and Power: The Transatlantic Fight over Freedom and Security' (with Abraham Newman, 2019) and 'The Political Economy of Trust: Interests, Institutions and Inter-Firm Cooperation' (2009).
